1. First, we need to identify all the scores from the table. We can do this by examining the 'score' column.
2. Next, we compare each score with the claimed lowest score of 206.

4. If none of the scores are equal to or lower than 206, then the claim is true.

| ...   |                |                                                  |                             | ...     |
|   1984 | fred funk         | thorny lea golf club                             | brockton , massachusetts     | 206     |
|   1983 | victor tortorici  | thorny lea golf club                             | brockton , massachusetts     | 214     |
|   1982 | darrell kestner   | thorny lea golf club                             | brockton , massachusetts     | 213 po  |
| ...   |                |                                                  |                             | ...     |

In this case, the score of 206 by fred funk in 1984 is indeed the lowest score in the table. Therefore, the claim is true.
